The best way to get strong is by using real weight. Anybody who has ever gotten strong has done so with the use of a barbell and a few carefully chosen dumbbells. If you want to get strong, you have to have the right tools on hand. The same goes for anybody who wants to get fit. Having the right equipment can make all the difference.

When it comes to getting strong, there are several ways to go about it. You can utilize a power rack or a weight bench to put different stresses on the muscles. You can vary your workout by adding or subtracting repetitions to increase or decrease your gains. There's also nothing wrong with using a few simple, inexpensive adjustable dumbbells to get strong. In fact, I prefer it that way myself. The key to strong workouts is to find the right balance between variety and consistency.

Dumbbells are a great addition to a fitness program because they allow you to exercise with minimal equipment. They're also versatile for use in a variety of workouts, including weightlifting, bodybuilding, and powerlifting. The best dumbbell set depends on your goals, available space, and personal preference. Invest in a set that focuses on muscle building if you want to gain strength and muscle.

If you want to lose weight and improve your overall health, consider a set designed with an emphasis on cardiovascular fitness. There should be an ideal set of dumbbells for each of these scenarios, but the reality often falls short of this ideal. Keep reading to find out why the following are among the best dumbbell sets you can buy.

Camo pants have been around for decades, but they're still a popular choice for special occasions. While there are several advantages to owning a pair of camouflage pants, such as being able to blend into the natural landscape or wear during a camping expedition, there are also a few disadvantages. For example, camo pants can make it difficult to be spotted in the wild by search and rescue if you are lost.

Most people who wear camo clothing do so because they like the way it looks, but don't realize how useful the fabric can be. When you're moving through the woods, it can be hard to get an accurate count of how many trees are around you, and being able to mark the location of nearby trees could save your life in a wilderness survival setting. When you're moving in stealth, you're able to identify potential threats or animals before they see you. If you want to move like a pro, you should consider investing in some high-quality camo pants.

I selected a variety of pairs from various top manufacturers and awarded points based on how well each performed in testing. The best camo pants earned a spot on our lineup. Read further to learn more about making the best choice for your needs.

EDC (Everyday Carry) is a term that describes a small blade carried in your pocket. This handy tool allows you to cut through rope, open packaging and other tasks where a larger tool would not work well. It's not uncommon for someone to carry multiple tools in their pockets, so having an EDC knife is a must-have item.

There are several benefits associated with carrying a folding knife in your pocket. For instance, they're easy to store and transport, making them convenient for anyone who carries them. Also, they're lightweight and compact, allowing you to easily conceal them under your clothes.

A good EDC (everyday carry) knife is a safe, reliable companion for your next outdoor adventure. An everyday carry (EDC) knife serves as a go-to tool for opening packages, carving a clean tip on a stick for marshmallow roasts, slicing through rope, and even harvesting a sprig of fresh herbs. An EDC knife can also be an important survival tool.

Whether you plan to hike the Appalachian Trail or just enjoy a weekend outdoors with the family, having the right EDC knife can make the entire experience more enjoyable. Read on to learn more about the how to find the best EDC knife for your needs.

Whether it's to help find your way in the dark or to let you see what you're doing when you rewound a screwdriver, a good camping flashlight is invaluable for outdoor adventures. You don't want to get caught in the dark with a weak flashlight, or worse, none at all. While many of today's flashlights are powerful and durable, they're not all ideal for use in the field.

When you plan to set up camp or go on an extended hike, the best camping flashlight will make your wilderness getaway safer and more enjoyable. But, with so many kinds available, choosing the best camping flashlight can be a challenge. A reliable, high-quality flashlight can transform your campsite into a miniature power station. Don't underestimate the value of a quality flashlight - it could save your life in the field.

If you're looking for great value, durability, versatility, and reliability, read on to learn more about how to make the best choice for your next camping flashlight purchase. We'll give you some tips and tricks on how to choose the right one.

If you prefer to rough it on your camping trips, foregoing an RV for a sleeping bag and a heated cabin for a tent, you know how challenging scoring a shower can be. Either you're throwing a stream of endless quarters into a public shower or you're hopping in the lake to get clean. Sure, it might be efficient and a throwback to the days of old, but there's a reason showers are so popular - and, with these camping showers, you can bring the comfort of home with you wherever you travel.

A camping shower allows you to relax comfortably after spending several days hiking through the woods or sleeping under the stars. But before purchasing a camping shower, you must first consider your preferences. Do you like to travel ligh? Or would you rather splurge and opt for a luxury camping shower?

While staying at a campsite might seem like a luxury, it can also be a logistical nightmare if you dont plan ahead. A good camping shower should help you avoid the hassles of carrying a heavy, shower bag and dealing with public showers. But there are certain factors to keep in mind when choosing the best camping shower while shopping for one of these convenient devices.

Of course, the convenience relies on you choosing a good option (one that won't break, will heat efficiently, and perform consistently). To help, we've researched everything you need to know about camping showers around so you can find the perfect fit.

A cross-draw holster is a great addition to any gunslinger's gear. Cross-draw holsters are one of the most popular styles for both concealment and open carry. They offer a number of advantages over other holster designs, including easier access to the gun and greater comfort when sitting or driving.

When you reach for your gun in a hurry, having it at the ready can mean the difference between life and death. A cross-draw holster allows you to do just that by putting your hand on the grip of your gun without committing the natural half-crouch, half-reach movement required to pull your gun out of its holster.

These holsters are made from durable materials like nylon and polyester and come in a variety of sizes to fit different types of guns. Some have additional features like provisions for a flashlight, a knife, and even a taser. A cross-draw holster is easy to operate and requires minimal effort to conceal your handgun. If you'd like to try out this unique method of carrying, then read further to learn more about cross-draw holsters.

If you think that only men should be allowed to own guns, think again. Women also have the right to bear arms, and there are plenty of good reasons for them to do so.

These new products feature lightweight designs that contour closely to the body for a secure fit while remaining unobtrusive and easy to wear. Many are made with a combination of materials, such as nylon and polyester, that wont easily tear or otherwise become damaged. Others feature strong, durable metal components and come with large belts that can accommodate a wide variety of guns. Still others feature quick-release systems that allow the wearer to go from a sitting position to a standing position without dropping their gun.

This guide will examine what features are important to consider when shopping for the best concealed carry holster for women and review some of the top models on the market.

Fixed-blade knives have earned a solid reputation for quality and performance, and the way knife enthusiasts talk about them, you might be tempted to think they're the best thing since sliced bread.

The phrase "fixed blade" is often dismissed by novices as just a fancy word for "bigger, wider, and heavier," but the reality is that there are several ways to achieve this goal, and the result is a plethora of different knives with various purposes and features.

I doubt there's more than a handful of readers out there who have their knives laying around on desks, tables, or chairs, and are tripping over them on the way to the bathroom, but that doesn't mean it's time for an epitaph just yet. In the meantime, let's take a look at some of the best fixed blade knives on the market and help you find the perfect fit.

Whether you're replacing a rusted grill, switching from gas to charcoal, or purchasing your first grill, a charcoal grill is an excellent addition to your backyard living space.

You might think that managing the heat on a charcoal grill can be tricky, especially if you're not familiar with how charcoal functions. Fortunately, charcoal grills come with built-in temperature regulators that allow you to control the fire and thereby manage the heat.

One thing that's not disputed is how easy it is to grill up a masterpiece with good old-fashioned charcoal. This fuel source is inexpensive, efficient, and easy to use.

Read on to learn about some of the best charcoal grills for cooking up tasty meals and to see why any of the following models deserve cheers!

Inspired by aviation, pilot watches are handy for their impressive features and novel designs. Uniquely stylish and highly functional, these terrific timepieces are adept at both keeping precise time and looking great on your wrist. As such, they make a worthwhile addition to any gent's collection. So, if you're a high-flying man who loves aviation, then this is the watch for you.

With a similar design template as field watches, aviators must be durable and simple, not ornamental.

The biggest historical differences with pilot timekeepers, other than who wears them, is that they're antimagnetic and often require higher accuracy than other watches.

The Philippines is often cited as the birthplace of butterfly knives, where balisong is a more appropriate term. Legend has it that the balisong knife has roots that go back to around 800 AD. This style of knife could be opened quickly with one hand and easily used as a weapon.

A butterfly knife is a fantastic piece of kit that's been around for as long as knives have existed. It's a simple, easy-to-use, and extremely effective tool. When it comes to martial arts, it is one of the most popular knives out there. The majority of butterfly knives are made from high-end steel, with some models even being able to be used in place of a chef's knife. This makes them ideal for use in any situation where a traditional fixed-blade may not be the best choice.

While they look similar, butterfly knives are actually quite different from each other. Keep reading to find out what factors to consider when selecting the best butterfly knife and why the following knives are among the finest on the market.

Winter is coming. You know what must be done. That's right, get those fires roaring and spike that cider because back porch living might be even better when the temperatures drop. Some people hunker down all winter and subject themselves to cabin fever, and those people are doing it wrong. We have warm clothes, we have drinks that warm our insides, and grills work just fine in the snow, thank you very much.

The last piece of this puzzle is a heat lamp to melt the frost right off of that patio and give you a comfy place to kick back and relax. These heaters are safe, generate plenty of heat, and can extend your back porch living into an all-season arrangement.

There are so many styles of heat lamps to choose from that we're willing to be there's something that checks all your boxes. If you're on a tight budget or only need to heat a small area like a garage or sunroom, you can score a heat lamp for as little as $65. If you want to go toe-to-toe with winter, add a few commercial heat lamps to your patio and melt a warm oasis into the snow. There are even options on this list with enough power to crank out 48,000 BTU of heat. That's enough for outdoor restaurants and event venues, so it'll be plenty for your wintertime festivities.

Hunting is one of those activities that requires total silence and complete stillness to be truly enjoyed. The ability to see and hear what is going on around you without distraction or interruption is a skill that takes years to perfect.

The best hunting blinds allow you to achieve that level of awareness and relaxation while remaining safely hidden from potential threats. They may also provide protection from wind, rain, and snow, keeping your gear dry, clean, and free of any debris that could blow or drift into the woods.

Like everything else in the hunting world, a blind is merely another tool in the hunter's bag. The point is not whether it is better to hunt with or without a blind, but that whichever way you choose, you do so with integrity and sportsmanship.

There is certainly more than one way to harvest a turkey or connect in bow season. The blind offers hunters a unique, and quite cozy, experience in the great outdoors.

If you think that the only option for surviving a disaster is to have a sturdy bag with enough supplies to get you through at least three days, you may want to take a closer look. Depending on the type of disaster, some people might not have access to food, water, or shelter for up to a week or more. Having a bug out bag can ensure that you are prepared for the unexpected and help you avoid being trapped in a situation where you need to make critical decisions while carrying insufficient information.

A bug out bag is a must-have for any prepper. The life-saving gear packed away into a bug out bag provides enough food, water, medicine, and other life essentials for a 72-hour trek to a safe location in unpredictable conditions. The best bug out bags have plenty of space for shelf-safe foodstuffs, water, an advanced first aid kit, fire starters, shelter equipment, and navigation gear. They feature plenty of pouches, pockets, sleeves, and more to pack everything you need for a solid bug out plan.

Of course, selecting a bug out bag is one thing: building the ultimate bug out bag is another thing entirely. A done for you bug out bag is certainly better than nothing, and there are companies that provide such a product complete with all the components they deem necessary. Some of you who are more ambitious may want to build your own bug out bag.

Consider taking the time to read this handy guide to packing everything you need for a bug out bag and nothing you don't.

Temperatures drop, but your zeal for home improvement projects doesn't. Good on you. Garages, workshops, and job sites aren't always the most forgiving places to be, and bundling up like the little brother in A Christmas Story can only do so much. You might be better off adding a heater to your repertoire and letting a can of kerosene take the frost out of the air. Compared to electric space heaters, kerosene heaters produce significantly more heat. They're also surprisingly efficient. Just a gallon a day can keep you warm for hours. There are a few considerations to keep in mind, like high temperatures and fumes that require adequate ventilation, but those are easy to account for.

When you're ready to take your winter projects to the next level, pick up a can of fuel and one of these kerosene heaters. You'll be up and running in no time.

There are two schools of thought when it comes to securing firearms. The first is to lock them up, and the second is to find a means to hide them. Both have their strengths and weaknesses, and unfortunately, binary thinking has limited us in options for both hiding and securing firearms.

A safe keeps money and valuables tucked away with a key. A hidden gun safe keeps firearms and other valuables tucked away with a key. That sounds pretty similar, right? Well, it is kind of the same thing, but with a twist.

Most people think that hidden gun safes keep your firearms secure while you sleep, but that's not entirely accurate. In order to properly and safely use a hidden gun safe, you must first crack open the door to the safe and retrieve the contents. Then, you must somehow lock the door back in place without anyone knowing you were there.

Carrying a handheld dose of pepper spray provides an extra layer of defense in situations where other means aren't permissible. There's also the added benefit of portability: Pepper spray can be as small as a roll of breath mints. Throw some in your pocket or glove box and have it with you at all times. Smaller sizes aren't necessarily less potent than larger ones, either; they just don t contain as much volume.

Pepper Sprays contain ingredients that result in coughing, inflammation around the eyes, temporary blindness and a burning sensation on the skin. All the effects of pepper sprays are not permanent but last long enough for you to get away from your attacker.

The active ingredient in a pepper spray is oleoresin capsicum, an extract from hot peppers.

The liquid inside your pepper spray will last a long time but check it every 3 months to make sure it is functioning correctly. If you can, replace your spray every year. When you do your Pepper Spray check make sure you are in an open area with no wind. Ensure that there is no-one near you (including your pets).

A multitool is a must-have for any serious outdoors enthusiast. Whether you're into hiking, camping, backpacking, or in need of a last-minute survival tool, a multitool can come in handy for a variety of situations. Most multitools are designed to be compact and versatile so they can perform a variety of tasks. While the overall size may remain the same, most multitools offer a variety of different tools for various purposes. The best multitools will have a variety of blades, knives, and other useful implements included. This gives you plenty of options for whatever task might arise during your next excursion into the great outdoors.

Whether you're looking for great value, durability, versatility, or reliability, read on to see which multitool is the best fit to keep your hands free and your mind sharp.

The world is polarizing and unpredictable, but that doesn't mean you have to leave your rock chucker at home. Take a look at the latest from SIG Sauer and you'll see that the company has kept its eye on the future while still looking backwards. The result is a handgun that's ready to handle whatever mission that you throw at it.

Sig P365s are popular among law enforcement officers, military personnel, and civilians who want to carry a reliable firearm without the worry of a gun slipping out of their hands. While these guns may seem like an obvious choice for those looking to improve their grip on their firearms, there are actually a number of considerations to weigh before purchasing one of these specialized holsters.

The first thing to consider is whether you should purchase a single- or double-stack P365 holster. This will depend entirely on your shooting style and whether you plan to carry your weapon in the traditional manner with two hands on the gun or if you want a more natural firing grip with one hand on the gun and one hand supporting the wrist. The second important factor to keep in mind when shopping for the best P365 holster is whether it should be worn on the left or right side of the body. There are differences in the way these two sides of the gun handle, which can make it difficult to determine which ones offer the best fit for your particular needs.

Luckily, we can help you out. By taking the mystery out of how to find the right P365 holsters, we've created a guide to help you choose the best SIG Sauer P365 holsters for your needs.

We've probably all been guilty of subscribing to the Super Troopers school of shot placement from time to time, but it's best not to admit that. Whether you're dialing your hunting rifle before opening day or scanning the horizon for trophy bucks, it's important to know what you're shooting at and exactly where your shot will land. That's where a GPS watch can help.

Most people think of GPS watches as devices for military personnel and outdoor adventurers, but that's only half the story. The other half is about how they make those decisions based on accurate, reliable information. For many who own a GPS watch, this is more than just a fashion statement - it's a matter of life and death. Navigating across rough terrain in a far off land requires a different kind of watch than counting steps around the office at your stateside staff job. When your next step could mean survival, why gamble again?

One of the biggest concerns when traveling around is still enjoying your home comforts, and if you count coffee as something you simply can't do without. In this case, a portabl coffee maker is a product you need in your suitcase.

But just because you're away from your usual coffee brewing kit doesn't mean you have to deal with the absence of coffee. There's a wide range of coffee makers for travel on the market, and we're here to save the day by helping you find the best one for your life and travel style.

If you think that a portable coffee maker is just an expensive, fancy suitcase-size blender, think again.

The best portable coffee makers have a variety of features that make them easier to use, including wide-ranging temperature settings, simple controls, and large, clearly labeled buttons. They also feature powerful processors that quickly heat water into its vapor form, allowing for fast, efficient extraction.

Read on to learn about what goes into the best portable coffee makers, and why the following models deserve cheers!

Whether for carving a clean tip on a stick of ice or scoring the perfect tip on a fresh, ripe piece of wood, a good bushcraft knife is an invaluable companion for outdoor activities. These high-quality camping and survival knives are also versatile tools for use at home, in the workshop, or while hiking.

Bushcraft knives are almost always fixed-blade knives with long blades with a flat edge. Bushcraft knives typically also have a grippy handle, which, these days, means that most are made of synthetic material, though some still do use wood.

Read on to learn about the features to consider when shopping for the best bushcraft knife and to find out why the following knives are among the best for outdoorsmen and women alike.

If you're looking for a way to purify water on the go, a water filter is a great option. It's pretty hard to get any more portable than a water filter. Water filters are fairly inexpensive and easy to use. If you've got some room in your budget, you can up your game with a hydration bladder or water bottle. Those who travel through areas where water is scarce know how valuable it is. Having access to safe water could mean the difference between life and death in the wilderness.

There are a lot of portable water filters out there, so we sought out the best backpacking water filters available. Check out our top picks below.

Mosquitoes are among the most dangerous adversaries of human beings, biting people in unpleasant places like the eyes, nose, and throat. While there are a variety of ways to protect yourself from being bitten by mosquitoes, one of the simplest is with a high-quality bug repellent.

Mosquito repellents include sprays that can be applied directly to skin or clothing, as well as lotions, creams, and oils that can be applied to skin or clothing. There are also physical options like air purifiers and bug repellent candles. This guide will explore what features are important to consider when shopping for the best mosquito repellent while reviewing some of the top products on the market.

If you're looking for a great backup carry option or a primary holster for your sub-compact or compact handgun, an ankle holster may be the perfect choice for you.

Ankle holsters may get a lot of flack for being difficult to draw from, but their ability to conceal-carry weapons can't be denied. In addition, with these holsters, you're able to carry a backup firearm to complement your primary one.

Self-defense is a human right. Carrying a concealed self-defense weapon is an art that must satisfy a number of requirements, and sometimes, an ankle holster is the only way to pack heat without attracting undesirable attention.

Some see ankle rigs as gimmicky, and some products certainly live up to that reputation. On the flip side, other ankle holsters have the potential to impress the most open-minded skeptics. As with any holster, the key is to find a solution that works for you and the environment(s) in which you live and work. Sure, ankle carry may not be for everyone, but when it's the best solution for you, be prepared with the right skills and the perfect holster.

Whether it's a weekend fishing trip, a cross-country journey, or any other outdoor adventure, having the right gear will make the entire experience more enjoyable.

The best camping tents are made from durable materials such as nylon and polyester (which tend to be the most durable tents) as well as thicker fabrics such as nylon and wool (which tend to be the warmest). These materials resist tearing and withstand snow, rain, and sleet. Theyre also packed with features that help keep you dry, clean, and comfortable.

If you're looking for a way to make your camping experience feel a little bit less like a field exercise, buying one of the best camping tents can be a huge first step. Instead of cooking dehydrated camping food and having the last song you listened to stuck in your head all night, you'll have the option to bring fresh food and crank up your favorite playlist.

Of course, this convenience relies on you choosing a good tent. To help, we've tracked down the best camping tents available along with some tips on finding the right fit.

A cabin tent is a great addition to any outdoor adventure. Sure, you might be aware of uber-gram-conscious ultra lightweight hikers who advocate cold-soaking your food and lightening your pack by leaving your tent behind. Don't listen to them. They're just jealous that you got a free cabin tent and they didn't.

A cabin tent is designed for comfort and privacy, not weight or size reduction. With that said, these tents are generally classified around two main characteristics: the number of sleepers (the more, the better) and the weather conditions they will be used in. Three-season tents tend to be designed for spring, summer, and fall use, while four-season tents tend to be made out of more rugged materials to withstand winter snow and high winds on mountains.

Finding the best cabin tent is important because, unlike a standard tent, a cabin tent must withstand snow, rain, and other outdoor conditions. It should also fit your needs and meet your budget.

This guide will help you identify what features you should consider when shopping for the best cabin tent while reviewing some of the top models on the market.

While you can't bring all the amenities of home with you, roughing it doesn't have to be miserable. Bringing some of the best camping food into the woods will help ensure that you enjoy the great outdoors while staying well fed, hydrated, and warm.

If you're looking for a way to make your camping experience feel a little bit less like a field exercise, buying one of the best camping foodstoves can be a huge first step. Sure, cooking over an open fire is still the best way to prepare a meal in the wilderness, but it can get monotonous and can't always be relied upon. If you've ever function-checked a spark plug, you know how intense a spark can be. The same goes for heat. Instead of chopping branches to create a makeshift grill, you can use a stove to cook up a masterpiece every time.

The best camping food should pack as much nutrition as possible without taking up too much room. That means filling your plate with fruits and vegetables. It also means packing plenty of protein, including eggs, meat, and fish. Finally, keep in mind that no matter how carefully you plan, things happen. The weather may change, a bear could tear through your tent, or a mountain lion might decide to share your campfire.

Whether it's a weekend fishing trip, a cross-country journey, or any other outdoor adventure that involves roughing it in the great outdoors, having the right gear is a necessity. You need to have a reliable tarp to keep your gear dry and protected from the elements. And with hundreds of models available, choosing the best camping tarps can be a challenge.

Tarp camping is a minimalist method of shelter construction in which a camper uses a tarpaulin, or tarp to shield their body and equipment from the wind, rain, and other elements. Camping tarps are durable, waterproof, and versatile pieces of camping gear in outdoor survival scenarios.

If you're looking for a way to make your camping experience feel a little bit less like a field exercise, buying one of the best camping tarps can be a huge first step. Most people are content with an old piece of cloth that may have been around since the Vietnam War era, but this doesn't do much to protect your gear from the elements. If you're looking for a way to keep your campsite clean and protected, consider using one of the best camping tarps available. These waterproof canvas or nylon sheets are ideal for protecting your hammocks, tents, and other outdoor structures.

Are you sick of cramming your entire family into small tents with overlapping sleeping pads and gear packed in every nook and cranny? Well, we're here to help you take your camping experience to the next level with the best four-person tents. With ample space, four-person tents are great for big groups - and even a couple dogs. But, you'll want to do a little research first, before picking out a tent of this size.

In this review, we've reviewed a variety of tents, from dome-shaped to cabin tents, to determine the best four-person tent for a variety of missions. We found tents well-suited for glamping and others good for three-season camping. Some have enormous vestibules (the camping equivalent of a mudroom), while others feature open, mesh exteriors for stargazing. While you'll want to look elsewhere if you want a lightweight backpacking tent, these top picks will meet all your backcountry needs.

The rifle scope mount, dedicated to providing users with quicker view sight and comfortable height, is becoming a necessity in various situations. Among different types of rifle scope mounts, the LPVO refile scope mount is becoming an increasingly popular mount choice for all kinds of shooting enthusiasts and professionals with numerous merits.

LPVO rifle scope mount is perfect for anyone looking for a magnified and fast shooting experience. It is a tactical scope mount that can provide a satisfying user experience. Below we discuss the top three reasons to opt for an LPVO rifle scope mount:

LPVO rifle scope mounts are designed to provide a comfortable user experience with getting a fast sight picture than standard height mounts. Meanwhile, it allows for more rapid visual processing of the battlefield by promoting a heads-up posture.

A suitable LPVO rifle scope mount places the scope's optical (mechanical) centerline at an appropriate distance above the rail, making it easier to hit targets at a longer distance. For example, a 34mm and 30mm scope mount allows for better vision as it perfectly accommodates different types of scopes.

The versatility of its use is another reason for its immense popularity. This type of mount can be used for both tactical and non-tactical purposes. It is excellent for hunting targets at mid-range or heading out to the range, along with military or other tactical applications.

Considering that binoculars are designed to bring clarity to your outdoor experiences, it's amazing how confusing things get when trying to decide which pair of binoculars is right for you. The original Damascus steel has gone through many changes over the years. The modern Damascus steel uses two methods during the making. It involves the forge-welding of different steels before twisting, beating, and manipulating the metal. Another way of making this steel is to flatten out and fold a single type of steel to create metal layers.

Both these methods will produce organic patterns in Damascus knives. The current techniques focus on the aesthetically appealing look.

However, the folding and refolding processes will have some benefits. They will purify the metal and can help with better results. Also, acid etching can create a unique pattern.

Drop leg holster is one of the most popular alternatives to the traditional gun belt and hip holster setup, drawing inspiration from the military and police units that use them in the line of duty. These devices feature a strap that goes around the lower portion of the leg just above the knee, with two straps that cross over each other and then attach to a buckle that sits just above the knee. When you run, the force of gravity pulls the leg forward, which gives the appearance of a natural gait while significantly lessening the impact on the joints.

By dropping the holster down from the gun belt to the thigh, more room is afforded for heavier body armor with side plates and pouches, plus freeing up some real estate on the belt itself for extra utility. By helping reduce muscle strain, a quality drop-leg holster can increase comfort and mobility.

Tritium is naturally occurring, but very rare. It can also be produced as a byproduct of nuclear energy. Because it takes about 1,000 years for Tritium to decay and become stable, it is sometimes called the "long-lasting battery." This makes it especially useful for watches since they can benefit from a power source that never runs out.

Tritium is a radioactive isotope of hydrogen that can be used to make luminous watch dials and hands. Unlike standard mechanical watches, which use quartz movements, tritium watches use either a rechargeable battery or an external solar panel to power their motors, making them ideal for those who prefer not to wear a traditional watch.

A slip joint knife is a type of folding knife that uses a simple mechanism to hold the blade in place. This is accomplished by using a slot and a small pin, or by using a spring-loaded mechanism. Slip joint knives are not designed to be locked in the open position and are therefore not considered to be true folding knives. However, they are still very useful and versatile tools.

In the world of safety eyewear, ballistics means military-grade impact protection. This standard differs quite a lot from that of safety eyewear for civilians. Ballistic-rated eyewear is designed and tested to survive the military's high-speed impact and fragmentation standards.

Unlike that of a regular flashlight, the role of a UV flashlight isn't so much to provide you with a light in the dark but rather to reveal what is missed with the naked eye. It is easy to forget that what we see in our everyday life isn't quite the objective fact we like to think of it as, with colors, for example, being somewhat of a subjective interpretation.

What we see is directly tied to how light refracts off objects, creating the color we perceive. While the color of a wavelength is an objective measurement, the colors we perceive are not. The perception of color is even different between species.

Sometimes we need a bit of help at seeing things that may not be highlighted or made visible through traditional wavelengths of light. Holographic sights offer a unique way to see beyond your ability with lasers. By creating a reconstructed image rather than simply projecting a LED dot or crosshair onto a pane of glass, they ensure that your reticle remains visible even in the darkest of settings. This is done by illuminating a reticle image stored on holographic film within the window. As the light from the laser passes through the objective lens and hits the film, it creates a replica of the object. Since this image is created by illuminating a specific pattern on the film, different objects create different images. By creating a reconstructed image rather than simply projecting a LED dot or crosshair onto a pane of glass, they ensure that your reticle remains visible even in the darkest of settings.

While there are no technical limits to how many objects you can see at once, your ability to see clearly will diminish as the brightness of the surrounding environment increases.

We also cannot ignore the possibility of looting, riots, and other dangers that expose your vital organs to stray bullets if they are fired.
